test_sync: This field should be added to all JSONs
_setup_instructions: IMPORTANT SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Replace all placeholder values marked with ${...}. 2. For each question in your assessment, add a corresponding category in questionRecommendations. 3. Ensure primaryCategory is set to your main scoring category. 4. Use the question's category name exactly as it appears in the questions section. 5. Each question should contribute to both its own category score and the primaryCategory score. 6. The paths in nextRoute should include the assessment ID (e.g., '/survey/your-assessment-id'). 7. Remove this _setup_instructions field when done.

intro.title: DISC Work Style Assessment
intro.subtitle: Discover your natural work style and communication preferences

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question based on your natural tendencies
Consider how you typically behave, not how you think you should
Focus on your workplace behaviors and communication style
Select the option that best describes your usual approach

columns.title: DISC Framework
columns.content: Understanding behavioral styles to improve workplace communication and effectiveness

points.description: How you interact and share information with others
Your natural approach to tasks and projects
How you evaluate options and make choices
Your role and contributions in team settings

intro.consentText: I understand this assessment will help identify my DISC work style preferences

items.text: How would you describe communication within your team?

options.text: Team members often misunderstand each other and have different communication styles
Communication is sometimes clear but other times leads to confusion
Communication is generally effective but could be improved
Team members communicate well with occasional misunderstandings
Communication is consistently clear and effective across all team members

items.text: How does your team handle conflicts and disagreements?

options.text: Conflicts frequently escalate and remain unresolved
Conflicts are often avoided rather than addressed
Some conflicts are resolved well while others linger
Conflicts are usually addressed but not always optimally
Conflicts are openly discussed and productively resolved

items.text: How similar or different are team members' approaches to completing tasks?

options.text: Extremely varied approaches often lead to frustration and friction
Quite different approaches that occasionally cause tension
Moderate differences that the team manages adequately
Similar approaches with a few complementary differences
Well-understood differences that the team leverages effectively

items.text: How does your team make decisions?

options.text: Decision-making is often contentious and difficult
Some team members dominate while others rarely contribute
Decision processes vary in effectiveness depending on the topic
Decision-making is generally inclusive but could be more efficient
Decision-making balances different perspectives and reaches consensus effectively

items.text: How would you characterize the social dynamics within your team?

options.text: Significant tension with clear personality clashes
Several team members struggle to work together effectively
Generally cooperative with occasional interpersonal challenges
Mostly positive relationships with good collaboration
Strong mutual respect with excellent working relationships

items.text: How well does your team adapt to different working situations and requirements?

options.text: Team struggles significantly when work approaches need to change
Adaptation happens but with considerable resistance
Some team members adapt well while others struggle
Team generally adapts well with some adjustment time
Team flexibly shifts approaches based on situational needs

items.text: How aware are team members of their own communication and behavioral preferences?

options.text: Very limited awareness of personal styles and their impact
Some awareness but rarely consider how styles affect others
Moderate awareness with inconsistent application
Good awareness but could benefit from deeper understanding
Excellent awareness with active adaptation to others' styles

items.text: Has your team received any personality or behavioral style training before?

options.text: No previous training of any kind
Brief introduction but no structured training
Some training but not specific to behavioral styles
Previous DISC training but needs refresher/deeper application
Comprehensive behavioral style training recently completed

base: Understand the four DISC styles and their key characteristics
Practice active listening techniques to better understand different communication preferences
Develop adaptability in your approach to different work and communication styles
very-high: Complete a comprehensive DISC training program with your team
Identify your primary DISC style and understand how it influences your work approach
Learn specific strategies to communicate effectively with each DISC style
Create team agreements for communication based on different style needs
high: Participate in a focused DISC workshop with your team members
Develop a style-based communication plan for your team
Practice recognizing different behavioral styles in workplace interactions
Set up regular reflection sessions to improve style adaptability
medium: Refresh your understanding of DISC principles through targeted resources
Practice adapting your communication approach with different team members
Identify specific situations where style conflicts occur and develop strategies
Create opportunities to leverage diverse styles on your team
low: Fine-tune your already effective style adaptation techniques
Help others on your team recognize and adapt to different styles
Apply advanced DISC concepts to complex team situations
Document best practices for style-based communication in your team
very-low: Mentor others in recognizing and adapting to different behavioral styles
Explore advanced applications of DISC in challenging workplace scenarios
Develop customized style adaptation strategies for your specific work context

primary_category.title: DISC Work Style Assessment
primary_category.description: Comprehensive evaluation of behavioral preferences and communication styles

high: Significant differences in communication styles causing friction
Limited understanding of behavioral preferences affecting teamwork
medium: Some awareness of different work styles but inconsistent application
Moderate adaptation to different communication preferences
low: Strong understanding of DISC principles and applications
Effective adaptation to different behavioral styles

high: Implement comprehensive DISC training program
Develop team communication protocols based on style preferences
medium: Enhance understanding of behavioral styles through targeted training
Develop specific strategies for adapting to different styles
low: Fine-tune advanced applications of DISC principles
Share best practices for behavioral adaptability

secondary_category.title: Work Style Adaptation
secondary_category.description: Assessment of flexibility in adjusting to different behavioral styles

high: Limited adaptation to different work and communication styles
Rigid behavioral approaches affecting collaboration
medium: Some flexibility in adapting to different styles
Inconsistent adjustment to diverse behavioral preferences
low: High adaptability across different behavioral styles
Effective flexibility in diverse team environments

high: Develop comprehensive style adaptation strategies
Implement behavioral flexibility training
medium: Enhance adaptation skills through targeted exercises
Build awareness of adaptation benefits
low: Refine advanced adaptation techniques
Mentor others in behavioral flexibility

disc_need.title: DISC Profile Overview
disc_need.description: Assessment of your primary and secondary DISC styles

high: Strong need for DISC-based communication training
Significant opportunity to improve workplace interactions
medium: Moderate understanding of DISC principles
Room for enhancing communication effectiveness
low: Good grasp of DISC communication styles
Effective use of behavioral adaptability

high: Complete comprehensive DISC training program
Practice style-based communication strategies
medium: Enhance DISC awareness through targeted exercises
Develop flexibility in communication approaches
low: Fine-tune advanced DISC applications
Share best practices with team members

communication.title: Communication Effectiveness
communication.description: Analysis of communication style and adaptability

high: Communication challenges affecting workplace relationships
Limited adaptability across different styles
medium: Basic understanding of communication preferences
Some ability to adapt to different styles
low: Strong communication adaptability
Effective across different DISC styles

high: Focus on style recognition and adaptation
Practice active listening techniques
medium: Enhance style flexibility
Develop situation-specific approaches
low: Master advanced adaptation techniques
Mentor others in style recognition

email_template.title: DISC Work Style Assessment Report for ${title}

report_structure.title: DISC Development Plan
report_structure.description: Based on your DISC assessment, we've created a personalized development plan focused on leveraging your natural style and improving adaptability:

critical_focus.title: Priority Development Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention based on your assessment:

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Plan
implementation_strategy.description: A structured approach to developing your DISC effectiveness:
recommendations: Style Assessment: Understand your natural DISC profile
Adaptability Training: Learn to recognize and adapt to other styles
Practice Application: Apply DISC principles in daily interactions
Feedback Loop: Gather input on communication effectiveness
Continuous Development: Regular review and adjustment of approach

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Tools and resources for your development:
recommendations: Access to DISC profile reference materials

Category Name.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Another Category.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

primary_category.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for primary category}
primary_category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for primary category}
primary_category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for primary category}

category_example.high: High priority recommendation example for this category
category_example.medium: Medium priority recommendation example for this category
category_example.low: Low priority recommendation example for this category

primary_score.high: Primary high priority recommendation for overall assessment
primary_score.medium: Primary medium priority recommendation for overall assessment
primary_score.low: Primary low priority recommendation for overall assessment

Communication Style.high: Focus on developing awareness of different communication styles and practicing adaptability in various workplace situations.
Communication Style.medium: Enhance your understanding of DISC styles and work on flexible communication approaches.
Communication Style.low: Fine-tune your already effective communication style and help others develop their adaptability.

Work Preferences.high: Develop strategies to work effectively with different DISC styles and adapt your approach based on the situation.
Work Preferences.medium: Build on your existing work style while incorporating flexibility for different team dynamics.
Work Preferences.low: Share your effective work strategies while continuing to enhance adaptability.

needLevel.label: very-high
needLevel.displayText: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from DISC training

needLevel.label: high
needLevel.displayText: There is a high chance your team could benefit from DISC training

needLevel.label: medium
needLevel.displayText: There is a moderate chance your team could benefit from DISC training

needLevel.label: low
needLevel.displayText: There is a low chance your team could benefit from DISC training

summaries.text: Your DISC profile indicates significant opportunities for improving workplace communication and effectiveness.
Your assessment shows clear areas where DISC-based development would enhance your workplace interactions.
You demonstrate moderate understanding of DISC principles with room for enhanced application.
You show good DISC awareness but could benefit from advanced application techniques.
You demonstrate strong DISC understanding and effective application in workplace situations.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the DISC Assessment!
thankYou.message: We've captured your natural work style preferences and will provide insights to help you communicate more effectively and work more productively with others.
thankYou.nextSteps: We'll analyze your responses and provide personalized recommendations for leveraging your DISC style. A specialist may contact you to discuss development opportunities.

scorecardInfo.title: Conflict Views
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate if your team would benefit from conflict resolution training and mediation techniques
